quote: Isn’t this where we came in?
author: Pink Floyd, The Wall

quote: Tempora mutantur nos et mutamur in illis. (Times change, and we change with them.)
author: ancient Roman proverb

quote: Don’t bury your burden in saintly silence. You have a problem?  Great. Rejoice, dive in, and investigate.
author: Ven. Henepola Gunaratana

quote: Wonder is the foundation of all philosophy, inquiry its progress, ignorance its end.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Our imagination is stretched to the utmost, not, as in fiction, to imagine things which are not really there, but just to comprehend those things which are.
author: Richard Feynman

quote:
I’m telling you this ’cause you’re one of my friends.
My alphabet starts where your alphabet ends!
author: Dr. Seuss, On Beyond Zebra!

quote: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think “I know, I’ll use regular expressions.”  Now they have two problems.
author: Jamie Zawinski

quote: My spelling is Wobbly. It’s good spelling but it Wobbles, and the letters get in the wrong places.
author: Winnie-the-Pooh

quote: East is East, and West is West, and never the twain shall meet.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Great fleas have little fleas upon their backs to bite ’em,And little fleas have lesser fleas, and so ad infinitum.
author: Augustus De Morgan

quote: Certitude is not the test of certainty. We have been cocksure of many things that were not so.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.
author: Frédéric Chopin

quote: A nine mile walk is no joke, especially in the rain.
author: Harry Kemelman, <cite>The Nine Mile Walk</cite>

quote: In the archonship of Aristaechmus, Draco enacted his ordinances.
author: Aristotle

quote: Every Saturday since we’ve lived in this apartment, I have awakened at 6:15, poured myself a bowl of cereal, addeda quarter-cup of 2% milk, sat on this end of this couch, turned on BBC America, and watched Doctor Who.
author: Sheldon, The Big Bang Theory

quote: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: Words, words. They’re all we have to go on.
author: Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead

quote: You’ll find the shame is like the pain; you only feel it once.
author: Marquise de Merteuil, Dangerous Liaisons

quote: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It’s the transition that’s troublesome.
author: Isaac Asimov (attributed)

quote: My specialty is being right when other people are wrong.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Go forth on your path, as it exists only through your walking.
author: St. Augustine of Hippo (attributed)

quote: Where’s the <kbd>ANY</kbd> key?
author: variously attributed
